title: How to Make Chocolate Cake with Ganache

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC and gather all of the ingredients.
In a mixing bowl, whisk together the flour sugar, butter, and baking powder.
steps.description: After the dry ingredients are incorporated, whisk the eggs in one at a time.

steps.headline: When everything is mixed well, add the chocolate syrup.
steps.description: Whisk until the batter is smooth. Then stir in the vanilla flavoring and salt

steps.headline: Place the parchment paper in the cake pan.
steps.description: If you do not have parchment paper, any nonstick spray will be fine.

steps.headline: Pour the batter into the cake pan.
steps.description: Put in the oven for 35 minutes.

steps.headline: Once the cake is done, let it sit and cool for 20 minutes.
Gently remove the cake from the pan.
Melt the butter in a saucepan on medium heat.
After the butter is melted, add the chocolate chips and sugar.
When the chocolate chips begin to melt and the sugar has dissolved, stir in the condensed milk.
steps.description: Bring to a boil for two minutes. If the ganache has boiled for more than two minutes, add more butter and condensed milk.

steps.headline: After the ganache has boiled, turn off the stove.
steps.description: Stir in the vanilla and salt.

parts.name: Putting the Ganache on the Cake

steps.headline: When the cake is done baking, remove from the oven.
steps.description: Allow it to cool before adding the ganache; if the cake is too warm, the ganache will melt on it.

steps.headline: Pour or spread the ganache over the cake.
The cake is ready to serve or can be covered and await eating later.

text: Making the Cake Batter Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC and gather all of the ingredients.  In a mixing bowl, whisk together the flour sugar, butter, and baking powder. After the dry ingredients are incorporated, whisk the eggs in one at a time. When everything is mixed well, add the chocolate syrup. Whisk until the batter is smooth. Then stir in the vanilla flavoring and salt Place the parchment paper in the cake pan. If you do not have parchment paper, any nonstick spray will be fine. Pour the batter into the cake pan. Put in the oven for 35 minutes. Once the cake is done, let it sit and cool for 20 minutes.  Gently remove the cake from the pan.  Making the Ganache Melt the butter in a saucepan on medium heat.  After the butter is melted, add the chocolate chips and sugar.  When the chocolate chips begin to melt and the sugar has dissolved, stir in the condensed milk. Bring to a boil for two minutes. If the ganache has boiled for more than two minutes, add more butter and condensed milk. After the ganache has boiled, turn off the stove. Stir in the vanilla and salt. Putting the Ganache on the Cake When the cake is done baking, remove from the oven. Allow it to cool before adding the ganache; if the cake is too warm, the ganache will melt on it. Pour or spread the ganache over the cake.  The cake is ready to serve or can be covered and await eating later.  Finished.
